Main Menu Help

Purpose of The Main Menu

The Main Menu is where you should logon with your e-mail address.

You can also The Main Menu to access other sections of the Waiting Room App.


App Tabs at the Top of the Screen

You can use the Tabs at the top of the Waiting Room App to access each section sequentially or as needed.

Note: You can use these Tabs is each section of the Waiting Room App.

You can also use the buttons in the middle ot the screen to move to each section of the Waiting Room App.


Logon

Enter your e-mail address and press the \"Logon\" button.


Next

Us the \"Next\" button on the bottom of each screen to progress from section to section.

My Record & Stats Help

Purpose of The \"My Record & Stats\" Screen

The \"My Record & Stats\" Screen is where you can review your official medical records.

You should reveiw them for accuracy and flag any items that are incorrect.

Note: Flagging an item doesn\'t change your official mediical records. Rather, it ensures that your physician verifies the data with you.

Its important to understand your medical records and are aligned with your phycisan\'s view of your health.


Information Review

On the lower right of the screen, your official medical records are displayed.

Here you can review your information and flag anything that looks incorrect.

Use the buttons on the lower left to move through each section of data.

Use the \"Chart\" button to graphically display the data.

Use the \"Flag\" button to request a review of the data with your physician.


Charts

A specific, easy-to-read chart will appear depending on the type of information you\'re reviewing.

Surveys & Quizzes Help

Purpose of \"The Surveys & Quizzes\" Screen

On the \"The Surveys & Quizzes\" Screen you have the opportunity to take a simple survey to screen for specific medical conditions.

Note: The surveys dsiplayed are specifically selected for you based on your medical records.


Surveys

Select each Survey and follow the instructions.

Your surveys are saved and can be reviewed with your physician.


The \"View Results\" button indicates that you\'ve already taken this survey. You can look at your stored results or take it again.

Use the \"Take Survey\" button to take a new survey.

Surveys Available

The surveys currently available are:

Breast Cancer Risk Assessment Tool

This tool estimates a woman\'s risk of developing invasive breast cancer. Invasive breast cancer is cancer that has spread from where it started in the breast into surrounding, healthy tissue. Most invasive breast cancers start in the ducts(tubes that carry milk from the lobules to the nipple.) Invasive breast cancer can spread to other parts of the body through the blood and lymph systems.


Melanoma Risk Assessment Tool

This tool estimates an individual\'s risk of developing melanoma during the next 5 year period and up to age 70, based on risk factors. Melanoma develops when unrepaired DNA damage to skin cells, (most often caused by ultraviolet radiation from sunshine or tanning beds) triggers mutations that lead the skin cells to multiply rapidly and form malignant tumors.


Diabetes Risk Assessment Tool

This tool estimates an individual\'s risk of developing Type 2 diabetes. Type 2 diabetes is a condition in which the body becomes resistant to the normal effects of insulin or doesn\'t produce enough insulin. This means that glucose stays in the blood and isn\'t used as fuel for energy. The high blood sugar level makes you feel thirsty, urinate more than usual and feel tired all the time.

Third Party Connections Help

Purpose of The \"Third Pary Connections\" Screen

The \"Third Pary Connections\" Screen allows you to connect your official medical records with all of your other health and wellness data.

For example, you can connect to your FitBit or 23andMe data.

This enables you and your physician to get a more complete view of your health.
